com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue

Interface YCPTokenAuthenticationUE


  • public interface YCPTokenAuthenticationUE
    This user exit may be implemented to provide custom logic for management of user authentication tokens.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createToken(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createToken method will be called when a new token is required for user.
      void invalidateToken(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The invalidateToken method will be called when a user logs out.
      org.w3c.dom.Document validateToken(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The validateToken method will be called to validate a given User/Token combination.

    • Method Detail

      • createToken

        org.w3c.dom.Document createToken(YFSEnvironment env,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                          throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The createToken method will be called when a new token is required for user.

        The implementation should generate or otherwise obtain a secure token and return it. It is up to this implementation to store the token if it is needed for later operations.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called when a user is validated and a secure token is required.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain a UserToken.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A Document containing the UserToken. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • validateToken

        org.w3c.dom.Document validateToken(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The validateToken method will be called to validate a given User/Token combination.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called to authenticate the user with the given UserToken.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should return IsValid if the token is valid for the given User. If a token is not valid, an exception may optionally be thrown instead of returning false.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A Document containing IsValid. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - on invalid user or any other error condition. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • invalidateToken

        void invalidateToken(YFSEnvironment env,
                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The invalidateToken method will be called when a user logs out.

        The implementation should remove or invalidate the current user token.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called when a user logs out.

        Post-conditions: The given user token should be invalidated.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
